vision.notes: Oval eyes with nictitating eyelids are present in all houndsharks.

mechanoreception.notes: As sharks, they possess a lateral line system for detecting vibrations and pressure changes in the water.

electroreception.notes: As sharks, they possess ampullae of Lorenzini for detecting electrical fields, aiding in prey detection.

olfaction.notes: Sharks have a well-developed sense of smell. Furgaleus macki (whiskery shark) has nasal barbels, suggesting a reliance on olfaction.

gustation.notes: The presence and use of taste in Triakidae sharks is not described.
